Key Match Events: Jaren Jackson Jr. was whistled for six personal fouls in the fourth quarter
Pre-Game Insights: Taylor Jenkins emphasized the importance of setting a different tone, especially on the road in the first quarter
Jenkins is fine running out the reserves and their individual efforts have been outstanding
Post-Match Reflections: Jenkins was disappointed in the loss and gave the Kings credit for their performance
He praised the team's fight to take a lead but noted they need to set a different tone, especially on the road in the first quarter
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Grizzlies have a history with the Golden State Warriors, even if the game might be missing some star power
Jenkins cannot let one bad night become a weekly trend, Memphis has too much on the line with Ja Morant watching from the sidelines
Others: The Grizzlies are in second place out West
Zach Edey and Brandon Clarke are back, and Luke Kennard had great playmaking, but the team needed more on the offensive side to overcome a poor defense
